c74object.name: threads~
c74object.digest: Writes incoming track data into a polybuffer~
c74object.description: The `threads~` object receives 4-item lists (palette, track, bar, offset) and writes them into a named `polybuffer~`. It uses a palette-to-channel mapping to determine which channel of a buffer to write to. Special values like 0 and -999999 are handled according to a specific multi-channel writing protocol.

inlet.description: The 4-item list from crucible or a similar source. Also accepts anything messages (like reach updates) on this inlet.
Accepts [palette_name, channel_index] pairs to register palettes, or the symbol 'clear' to reset all mappings.

outlet.description: Outputs diagnostic information when the verbose attribute is enabled.

objarg.name: polybuffer_prefix
objarg.description: The base name of the polybuffer~ (e.g., if prefix is 'script', it will look for 'script.1', 'script.2', etc.).

method.name: list
method.description: Parses the 4-item list and writes data to the appropriate buffer and channel.

method.name: anything
method.description: Used on the second inlet to map palette names to channel indices or clear the map. On the first inlet, handles formatted messages similar to the data list.

attr.name: verbose
attr.description: When set to 1, the object outputs diagnostic information and sends data to the visualizer script.
